page.title: 05 The Cross
page.content: The Cross is in the centre of { {Linlithgow}and was once called {Cross {Well.}The road around it was cobbled but now half of it is tarred.A statue of {John Hope }the seventh Earl of { {Hopetoun}once stood there but now it stands at the{Rose Gardens}near the Cross. Round the{Cross}there used to be food sales,livestock auctions, public executions,royal proclamations, and witch burnings.The{fountain}was carved by one man called {Robert Gray. The carvings on the well show local characters of the time.Round the{Cross today there are shops and flats. Overlooking the{Cross}is the{Burgh {Halls}and an information centre.Across the road from the{Burgh Halls}is the {Cross House}which is an historic building used for church activities.At the other side of the{Burgh Halls}is the{Masonic Halls.
